Reviews.Title: “truth is simple this is not for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: tazzyjay
Reviews.Content: ok lets go ill keep it as simple as possible. we have just got back late last night from this hotel / citybreak to Rome 18/04/2012 food for breakfast its simple basic just a few rolls /cakes cereal juices tea and coffee machine not fresh some cheese / and ham thats about it but quality is not bad. the rooms where just basic and averidge no chairs in room just the beds and not a bad shower facility again very basic there is no air conditioning the shower head is very lowly placed so you would have to hold it in your hand to operate it. the plug sockets all have 3points european but you can get a cheap adaptor for 1.00 euro from the supermarket next door ( the staff were helpful at the hotel) the guy in the restaurant was very polite and helpful. there is a pizza bar and very nice supermarket as I was with my wife and 2 year old son I do not recommened this hotel at all as far as location goes. its not anywhere near the centre of Rome unlike the sales pitch we where given. once the plane lands at the airport a leonardo express to termini station which is the centre of Rome which is 14.00 euros per person/ then you take a metro which is only 1.00 euro for 75minutes you must validate all tickets for the train and metro/bus which had very few lifts but so many stairs to climb again because we had a childs buggy made it very difficult how a disabled person would use this I have no idea. at the end of the line line A station called Anaglinia. you have to wait approx 15 minutes depending time of the day for a 507 bus which takes you to the hotel which is approx 5 to 6 stops ask the driver not that they are helpful !!! you cant really stay out late otherwise be prepared for expensive taxis. Rome it self was an Amazing experience. some much to see so much to do the ice creams pizza pasta all delicious but just be vary of the various touts all over Rome selling fake goods I would say. just like any Country be careful of how you travel and stay to the main roads where most of the people are. just bear in mind I do not recommend this hotel for familie with small children at all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucyhaevey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Arcadia in January when on a 4 night break in Rome as part of a cheap last minute travel deal. I had read some bad reviews on trip advisor after booking the deal so was slightly wary of what we would find but I would definetley recommend this hotel for people wanting to see Rome on a budget. The hotel is a bus and metro journey from the centre of Rome, but at €2 pp each way you can't complain! The buses are very regular and if you miss it at the stop outside the hotel you can walk around the block and still make it in time! The staff were very friendly and helpful, answered all our queries. The room was clean and tidy, everything in working order. The breakfast is quite basic but enough to set you up for the day. The supermarket and pizza shop next to the hotel are ideal for food when back from a long day sightseeing. The hotel was very quiet for our first few days but when more people arrived in the week you could hear tv's and talking from other rooms, but not enough to disturb us. The electricity cut out the morning of our departure but was fixed within about 20 minutes. It was a pleasant stay on a budget, would definitely recommend and stay again, don't let bad reviews put you off if you are looking for somewhere to put your head down after seeing Rome, if looking for 5* luxury, this place isn't for you!

Reviews.Title: “hard to find”
Reviews.Author: bigbobBristol
Reviews.Content: hired a car to get to the hotel from the airport seemed a good idea there is no signs and google maps directions took me nowhere would hire a sat nav next time but £9 per day ! the hotel is ok but no sound proofing like staying in a 18-30 hotel but the breakfast was good and the staff was ok, the bus and tram works great 1 euro and your at the sites 45 min tops, the pizza place near is more of a pizza delivery place with a few seats open till 23.59 7 days

Reviews.Title: “mitchell”
Reviews.Author: mitchell213
Reviews.Content: Stayed three night, in January. Rooms ok, clean and nice bathroom. They ran a shuttle service from the nearby metro. You could buy a ticket at the Hotel. 1 euro took you into the centre of rome. A bus stopped opposite, this took you to the metro stop. Quite easy. No bar, but a little bar and piza cafe up some steps above the Hotel, and a supermarket in the same block. Staff very helpful. Buffet breakfast, but very nice. We had a lovely cheap break .

Reviews.Title: “Too far out”
Reviews.Author: lynmarie58
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read previous reviews but thought it can't be all that bad, however most reviews are accurate!! The hotel is more like a 2 star motel with NO facilities - you can't make a cuppa or even get one from a machine. There is NO BAR despite the hotel advertising one. There was a fridge in the room containing 2 bottles of water. Breakfast is continental but no fruit or yoghurt was available. The hotel is too far out of Rome to be called city centre. You have to take the metro to the end of line A (Anagnina) then get the 507 bus to the hotel. We arrived in the dark on a Friday night rush hour and tried to wait for taxi but there were none. Quite by accident I saw the 507 and the driver told us where to get off - 5 stops I think. The next morning we caught a bus at 9am and were in the centre at 9.40am with a good connection. The only good point about the journey into Rome is that it only costs 1 Euro. Unfortunatly you can't stay too late in Rome to enjoy the nightlife as you have to rely on the metro/bus otherwise get a very expensive taxi. The hotel shuttle operates only between 4pm and 10pm.to the metro station. If you telephone the hotel to let them know you want picking up, they will come to Anagnina. There is nothing to do once you are back at your hotel, there are no bars around so you are stuck in your room with Italian TV. We found a supermarket behind the hotel and bought beer and snacks but it closes at 8.30pm so stock up early. The hotel is noisy and looks unattractive as the bins are stored at the front of the hotel and there are industrial units across the road. The room we had (204) was clean and the bed was large and comfortable.The bathroom is decent but it is difficult to get a good shower with a hand held shower head. Rome itself is wonderful - get a map and walk so you don't miss anything.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazman66
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights in October and the hotel is of average quality. The staff are lovely, including the cleaners and breakfast room staff. The hotel is situated ideally for Campino Airport, however, to get into the city centre, you need to get a 15 minute bus trip to Anaganina Metro station and there is then a 20 min trip on the Metro to Termini Station (the central station in Rome) this means that once your out for the day, you really need to stay out as coming back to the hotel (to freshen up before going out at night for example) isnt really an option. The last metro train to Anagnina is at 9pm, so no late trains other than a Saturday night. Travel is really cheap however. The surrounding area at the hotel is not good, a lot of graffiti, rubbish bins over flowing outside, generally a poor area all around. The staff do their best, however, we wont return to the hotel the next time we're visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Eldadben
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotels for 3 nights. The one and only good thing i can say about the hotel is that it was kind of clean. beside that, it was a real bad choise to stay in for my trip to Rome. To get from the hotel to the center of Rome takes around 1 hour and is not available around the clock, so when we got out at night we had to get back with a taxi (around 30 euros) the ride from the airport and to the airport (leonardo int.) costed 60 euros each way (no transfers). There is NOTHING to do or eat and nowhere to go within a walking distance of the hotel and you better buy some stuff for the night if you want anything beside mineral water. The breakfast was bad and basic, the soundproofing was bad. The staff had 1 min patience and gave us the feeling we are interupting them. In the middle of the 2nd night i woke up all swetty to find out the A/C is not working, the receptionist told us in the morning that the owner told her to close the A/C to the entire hotel because its "cold enough" and because it makes air pollution (NO KIDDING!!!) and after i said i have never heard of such a thing she said she won't hear anymore since she had too many complainst this morning and she can't handle it. Do yourself a favor, stay away from this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “too basic and will never return”
Reviews.Author: pejones
Reviews.Content: Only good thing was the air conditioning, although old, did work and the hotel's location to the airport was fine. We were charged 20 euros from the airport to hotel and 30 euros from the hotel to airport for 4 people. Hotel was in a dreadful area, which looked undesirable at night. We asked for an extra pillow for each of us. They only managed to find 3 pillows! We asked where the bar was, but there isn't one despite advertising that there is a bar, so you are basically confined to your room at night. The walls are so thin you hear lots of noise during the night, especially when a door is opened and closed. The breakfast was awful, croisants had a sugar topping, the cheese unrefrigerated, the meat tasted like spam, the orange juice was like a cordial rather than a refreshing juice. However the place was clean and the female receptionist was pleasant. The evening male staff were unfriendly. Travel into Rome centre was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: ZanmanLondon
Reviews.Content: Located near Anagnina at the end of Linea A underground station there is a shuttle bus service from 16.00 to 22.00 Mondays to Saturdays and all day Sunday, otherwise you can use the normal bus service no. 506 or 507 to Anagnina. Tourist hotel which whilst not perfect is very well priced. Good standard breakfast. Clean rooms. Maintenance OK. Very helpful lady at the front desk although her male colleagues could take a leaf out of her book. The hotel is lacking a Bar so make sure you bring some drinks as the Mini Bar is bare. TV difficult to operate with few channels. Good hotel for bed & breakfast...nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away - Ghastly place”
Reviews.Author: Roz069
Reviews.Content: Stay well away from this hotel - everyone is out to rip you off. Due to a late night flight and travelling with children we decided to spend the night near the airport before embarking on our journey for our holiday the next day. Although only 3KM from Ciampino Airport the taxi cost 50 euros and the next day the driver of the shuttle bus wouldn't drop us off so cost us another 50euro to return to the airport to collect hire car. Th e hotel was clean enough but as others have reported it is in a very run down area with a grotty pizzeria as the only place to eat. Breakfast whilst included in cost was very poor - cold meats - warm, dried up pastries - all pretty awful. Also my son left his trainers under the bed and when we phoned to arrange collection(speaking fluent Italian) - guess what ?- no sign of them - obviously gone walkabout..... Very upsetting start to our holiday - ripped off by taxi drivers - 100euros out of pocket before we'd even started and then loss of shoes. Then as we left had to pay 12euros tourist tax even for the kids....... Glad I live in Britain - makes you appreciate what you have.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and would go again”
Reviews.Author: SAmericantraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend a couple of nights in Rome at the end of a holiday to the Marche region. Since we had a hire car we were attracted to the free parking and shuttle bus to the metro. (Free parking in Rome itself is impossible). The hotel was very clean and whilst basic was very comfortable. The breakfast was a typical continental style so don't expect massive eggs and bacon but the bread, cereal and croissants sufficient to set one up for the day. Running coffee (or tea) was a real bonus. Reception very helpful and good English spoken. The area is in the suburbs abnd there is a lot of graffiti, a little distracting at first but there do not appear to be any problems with the area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE FOR WHAT YOU GET..HAPPY TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: 1018jackie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 night break. Easy to get to the hotel by using 2 buses at a cost of 2.20 Euros each..Bargain. Get the bus from outside the airport to Anagnina station (you can pay n this bus)..then jump off at the station, Go downstairs to the ticket office get a ticket for 75 mins 1 euro..then come back up and you want bus 507...ask for the hotel the bus stops right out side the hotel...Its better than it looks so dont worry !! We found getting a wad of tickets from the hotel worked for us..you get the bus in the morning back to Anagnina station then get on the metro Using the same ticket ( it lasts fro 75 mins once punched in the bus ticket machine (On the bus)..you can get anywhere on the A route metro. We was spending 2 euros a day each..Much cheaper than the rome passes at 25 euros for 3 days.. The hotel was fine, The staff lovely and helpfull. They have a bus that runs after 4.00 to Anagnina you just ask and they will take you..We used it to get back to Anagnina to get the bus back to the airport.. Lovely white fluffy towels room cleaned every day Breakfast was basic but pleasant enough..A couple of different croissants jams honey, Cereals, fresh rolls ..Ham and cheese.. Juice thats the powdered stuff..just give it a stir its ok ..Coffee is drinkable..(Just) Out the back is a little cafe/bar that serves meals snacks..the food is fine . there is a supermarket behind the hotel..got all our drinks there and popped them in the room fridge..no problem. Bed large and quite firm...very very comfy ... Now the only downside to the hotel............Every time someone slams the door it echos through the hotel...some people are so damn thoughtless, Its not hard to close a door quietly. Im sure a little bit of that sponge stuff around the inside of the door frames would sort the problem easy !! Its not a 5* hotel but your not paying 5* prices... I wouldnt hesitate to go back..takes about 30 mins to get from hotel to Rome centre...for the price ..Thats a bargain So worry not about the negative reviews ..Im sure you will be pleasantly surprised ... I suggest you take drinks with you ..its not unheard of to pay 3.5 euros for a can of coke !!..In fact its the norm. Have fun x

Reviews.Title: “This is FAULTY TOWERS”
Reviews.Author: fastnet50
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel this month and here are the bare facts. The hotel is the noisiest place i have ever stayed. Be prepared to be awake until everyone goes asleep, and be awakened when somebody gets up early which is about 6am. The hotel has no sound proofing at all and when someone walks its just like they are in the room with you. Also the hotel is in the sticks, meaning miles from anywhere (1 hour to city centre by bus and rail). Breakfast is served between 7am and 10 am which is fairly meagre. After 10am you cannot purchase any coffee, tea at this place at all. You have to visit a tiny pizzeria called more games Jolly Pizza to purchase anything after breakfast. There is no bar at all so if like us you come back around 7pm you have nowhere to go and nothing to do unless you fancy a pizza in Jollys. Also the television has no working english channels, one german and one italian. I am not a crank and have travelled a lot and this is the first time i have really complained about where i have stayed. My advice is dont go there, and if you do you will remember this review and wish you had taken more notice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: martin_jicata
Reviews.Content: okay so once you arrive at campino airport you can go outside and wait at the 2nd stop, get on the first bus there and the ticket is 1.20 euro per person. get off at the last stop which is around 40 mins from the airport depending on the traffic. once at anagnina station, get on the 507 bus which takes you right outside the hotel within 15-20 mins. the ticket is 1 euro. it was on the 5th stop if im not mistaken but you can ask the driver to let you know when you have to get off. once in the hotel, the reception staff was always welcoming and kind and the rooms were much better than expected.. when i read the reviews i was expecting something disguising but it was actually clean, towels were changed everyday, beds were made and the sleep was excellent.. i guess it was all that walking thought lol. the breakfast is rediciously cheap though.. still gets something in your belly but wow... pieces of bread, some butter, ham and 2 types of croissants.. also the drinks were rubbish. as for Rome... it was great but really if you're going for 4 days leave a big attraction for each day or you will be slightly disappointed... the food is around 12 euro per person including drinks depending on where you dine but yea.. a good 40 euro per person a day. on the way back to the airport its the same principal as coming to it... to get to the city centre you need to get the bus back to aniginina station (you can get the bus from the same station you get off as it takes 1 minute to get on the other side of the road). once at aniginina station, you go down the stairs and it takes around 30 minutes to the central stations. OH!! Don't forget to get ROMA PASS which is really useful and saves stress and around £20 a person if you add it up.. it costs £25 and it includes unlimited travel on tram, metro, buses + 2 free passes to a museum or architectural/historical attraction.. we chose the coliseum which was around £15 per person and some castle which wasn't too expensive but we had nowhere to waste the second free entry anyway. have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “so far away from Rome needs one hour of travel to get anywhere near”
Reviews.Author: nicky215
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean in the rooms and the breakfast of croissant and coffee was actually pretty decent, The web site says that they have a shuttle bus-technically they do -but only is operative on sundays when local bus service is not so good and is then shared between 2 other hotels. unfortunatley The location kills this hotel. If it was near the tube it would be,- basic- but okay we had a short 3 night stay. The web site for the hotel is evry misleading-there is no bar in the hotel and nothing at all within 2-3 miles were you could get a drink or a quick glass of wine. To get from the central station to this hotel involves 15 subwat stops -out at the bus stop then a long bus trip. In teh morning this was okay but on a n evening just no good. im sure there are much better hotels closer or even in Rome that i could easily recommemnd. Go to Rome though its magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean, great location close to beautiful Frascati !”
Reviews.Author: qppq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for people on a budget who want somewhere clean and comfortable at an amazing price. It is a fair bit from Rome centre (about 30 mins) but the hotel runs a great shuttle service to Rome. The hotel is (as the name implies) in an arcade which consists of mainly offices, a few small businesses, a good PAM supermarket and a small snack bar with (good) pizzas etc. The rooms are basic but clean and as good as hotels charging 4 times the price in the UK. This hotel may not be for the lazy traveller who wants everything done for them, but I have stayed here half a dozen times and I will return. Don't worry about the negative reviews, some people will always complain, go and enjoy it !

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, 10 min bus and 30 min metro before you are in city centre”
Reviews.Author: RachelandBilly
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome from 10th-14th March with my friend. We are two girls age 25 and we arrived at Rome airport at about 10 at night. The reason I tell you this is because you NEED to be careful when paying for a taxi from the airport! I got into the taxi and asked the driver to put the journey on the meter as reading reviews Id heard this is the best way to get a fair price. Our driver fiddled with his meter machine and told us it would take 15 mins to get to the hotel. On arrival at the hotel, the driver fiddled with the meter again and after just a 10 minutes journey charged us 50 euros! Being late at night and 2 young girl, we decided to give him the benefit of the doubt and I gave him a 50 euro note. As I put my purse away he said to me 'youve only give me 10 euro and showed me a 10 euro note (same colour as a 50 note), i tried checking my money again and he was very pushy and said 'theres a 50' which i handed over, he gave me the 10 back. Needless to say, I was well and truly had, paying 90 euros for a 10 minute taxi! If you book this hotel, the journey shouldnt be any more than 30 EUROS. Anyway, back to the hotel... so we came in and the guy on the desk wasn't very welcoming or friendly. There are no bars, restaurants around the hotel. All there is is a suprtmarket (closed at night when we got there) and a 'pizzeria' which i put in inverted commas because it was more like a type of kebab shop/cafe, which was full of young local boys. because were hungry we decided to try it out and ventured over towards it but were followed but didnt like the look of it and were then followed until we go back to the hotel. Hungry and unhappy, we went on the internet straight away (which we weren't asked to pay for) and booked another hotel called the Hotel Gambrinus in Porta Pia. We stayed the night in the Hotel Arcadia. It was noisy and couldn't sleep, especially as the dumpster bins (right at the front of the hotel) were being emptied by dustbin men with beeping vans at midnight! Breakfast was basic but OK, again the staff weren't friendly, you just got on with it yourself really. To get to Rome (because by this point we didn't feel like we were IN rome!) you take the 507 Bus which come fairly often. You dont have to pay on for the bus I dont think. The metro is 1 euro per use or you can get a 11 euro tourist ticket which I recommend getting from the very beginning because if youre like us, you use the metro alot! (The metro is so easy!) I can't remember where you get off, but then you get on the metro at the Aranina (sp?) line and take the metro to wherever you want to go. In all this will take 10 mins plus half hour to get to the main Termini station. We are so glad though that we changed hotels. We stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus like I said, and this cost us £70 each for two nights, but the hotel was gorgeous and the staff were so friendly and we were only a ten min walk to the metro and then using the metro took us anywhere. It was nice for us to go out in the morning, come back in the late afternoon to refresh for an hr or so and then go back out. I wont say don't book this hotel. It suits the purpose of having a room to sleep in, but dont it doesnt really feel like youre really on a nice holiday in Rome or Italy and I couldnt relax until we left. That said, if you plan on going into rome centre early and then coming back late, this is ok and fits the job for a clean room to sleep in. Hope this helps! Rachel x

Reviews.Title: “YOU PAY FOR WHAT GET!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sexypudz
Reviews.Content: "HONEST OPINION" You pay a budget price and you get a budget hotel. Flight with easy jet was pleasent,coming out the airport was to say the least very confusing,ended up getting on a bus that took us into rome that cost around 9euros and took 90mins which drop'd u off about 10 mins from the metro trainstation (very confusing) then had to get a train to arganania (LINE A) which ment us going back to where we really started!!!!!! so once we got to the termini we got on the correct BUS 507 to the ARCADIA hotel,takes about 15mins to the hotel,please remember as you see this hotel and the surrounding ground and area remember what you paid BUDGET its a little off putting by the metal shutters on the windows and the bins along side the road.Overall the room was clean and very basic but the walls are very thin so expect hearing the conversations of italians! Rome is very expensive dont be shocked to pay around 5 euros for a bottle of coke!! no lie,and a average meal is around 40 euros,so take enough money with you! But i honestly LOVED rome and all the sights

Reviews.Title: “You won't see Rome from here..................”
Reviews.Author: popeduncaniv
Reviews.Content: We booked a romantic city beak to view the historic and cultural experience that three days in the heart of an ancient yet metropolitan city would bring. Having travelled by taxi from the nearby airport, I wiped the condensation from the car window to catch sight of the dull neon welcome of the 'Arcadia' Hotel. i would not have been surprised to see the ominous visage of Norman Bates himself in the foyer. Upon entering the rather basic and depressing room which contained little more than a camp bed and a twelve inch portable television i was then faced with the challenge of hauling up a metal screen shutter covering the balcony window with the passion of the Hunchback of Notre Damne combined with the willpower of a 1930's Wall Street banker not to jump onto the vacant and tart filled streets below. A short walk around the neighbouring streets revealed nothing more than the motivation to learn a little of the local lingo, which included ' I'VE BEEN ROBBED' and 'I'VE BEEN HAD'. With absolutely nothing to do but return to the depressing prison of the Arcadia, we chose to peruse the selection of drinks that the mini bar had to offer, but without a successful bid for my left kidney on e-bay, decided that our money would be better spent. After settling down for the night on a camp bed worthy of an average Afgan refugee, we awoke to the promise of checking out and utilised the in house internet facility to book another hotel in a distant place called 'Rome' which bore a remarkable resemblance to the place we had originally wished to visit through Thomas Cook. After a one and a half hour journey, we arrived in the city we had hoped to see and saw the welcoming outline of the vatican and the aged marble walls of the Colosseum, rather than the corregated iron roofs of the local industrial estate and decaying suburban rot that the Arcadia had to offer. If it can be believed that the actor Russell Crowe (GLADIATOR), trashed a hotel room then one can only speculate at the frustration he felt towards the room in which he stayed..............

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel if you want a city break!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBird007
Reviews.Content: Looking at the other reviews my feelings about this place are much the same. We went to Rome for 3 days and when you're on limited time in such a fab city you want everything on your doorstep. The Hotel Arcadia is not the place to stay to see the Rome you go to see. It's not the hotel's fault - if you only want convenience for an airport then grab a room here for sure. I place the blame for my review of the hotel firmly at the door of Thomas Cook who had this hotel on offer for a city break when it just simply shouldn't. It took us nearly an hour and three quarters to get into Rome itself using the bus, metro and our reliable feet in order to avoid the truly extortionate taxi fees which had we stayed here for the duration, we would have ended up using out of sheer frustration. There was nothing close to the hotel - no restaurants, no bars and certainly no Roman sights. The hotel itself is advertised as a 3 star but I'm not sure that appropriately reflects it as the new hotel we booked instead was 4 star and of a far superior quality in every way. We could not wait to leave the Arcadia and begin seeing the Rome we came to see from our new city centre base!!

Reviews.Title: “A little out of Rome”
Reviews.Author: rachelh3826
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Arcadia for 1 night, it was a little too far out the centre, you needed to get a bus to metro which took 5/10 mins then the metro took 14 stops to get into central rome. The hotel itself was quite dirty outside, and there was a lot of litter from nearby supermarket. There was also quite a bad smell which i imagine was coming from all the litter. Reception staff were very helpful and spoke very good english. Our room was very old fashioned but clean, we didn;t spend a lot of time in the room as theres so much to see in Rome. The breakfast was basic, cereal and pastries but was very good!

Reviews.Title: “grotty hotel in the back of beyond”
Reviews.Author: BQ1259
Reviews.Content: If you are disabled avoid this like the plague. It is 2.5 k from the metro anagnina which is impossible to access by wheelchair.There is no lift and the metro is 5 flights down. The hotel is poorly presented the lift does not allow time to get a wheelchair in or out the room 209 was stark with only 1 curtain present the shower cubical door was hanging off the shower head was broken the tiles were cracked and dirty. Breakfast was cheap poor quality and grudgingly served by some dolly bird who seamed upset that we tourists were interupting her day. We were treated to a sexual marathon through the paper thin walls starting before midnight and going on until 05.30 until i hammered the wall and asked were the couple concerned finished so that we might get some sleep. The hotel is placed in an industrial/ residential area , not a green area as advertised by Jacob online the booking agent . All in all my king charles spaniel has better quarters than this dump

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great value, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicky-Plymouth
Reviews.Content: For the money this hotel is great. Outside the main city but handy for Ciampino Airport. The fantastic public transport system made it easy to go into the city each day. I was unlucky enough to have my purse stolen whilst on a bus in the city (I thought I had been careful - still haven't worked out how they got it!), and the staff at reception could not have been more helpful - they found the numbers I needed to make the phonecalls to stop my cards etc. I was on their desk phone for ages! The shuttle service does exist contrary to other reviews, we used it on Sunday when the 507 bus had a limited service, but to be honest when the bus stops outside the hotel why would you need a shuttle service as well? Tckets on this bus can be used on the Metro too, so there is no extra expense incurred using the service bus. The room is basic, but it does have a minibar with reasonable prices, which for us doubled as a fridge to keep some bits of food in. A supermarket is attached to the hotel so it's easy to get anything you need. Towels were brillliantly white and thick... bathroom was clean... breakfast was basic. but adequate... we would definitely go back to Rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a miss”
Reviews.Author: chickadee34
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?? We went to Rome for 3 nights and didn't realise that this hotel was so far from the city centre. We wasted so much time traveling to and from the hotel that we wasted so much time. The hotel itself is ok, it's very basic but clean. I found the bed extremely uncomfortable and the walls were paper thin so you could hear your neighbours TV blaring at 2 am. Not good. The breakfast very basic too but hotel staff friendly and helpful. You have to get a bus to the metro station but you could be waiting up to half an hour to jump on the bus then the Metro can take 30 -45 minutes. When you have so little time to see everything it would be more convenient to stay central. We came home exhausted. Saying that, Rome itself was amazing but if I was going back, I would definately stay closer to city. Once you leave in the morning you don't return until night due to the fact that the hotel is so far out. You can't just pop back to freshen up or take a nap. I found taking the Metro at night quite scary. It's crowded and I had heard so many stories about pickpockets, that I became paranoid!! I was away with my elderly mother and the whole experience just wasn't as enjoyable for her as it should have been. The hotel has no facilities whatsoever, so even if you fancied an evening in, there's nothing to do. Very disappointing but a big thumbs up to Rome itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, enjoyable vacation.”
Reviews.Author: iLobster
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel, it's a safe choice. Clean and nice rooms with balconies, and nice service. The only drawback is that the closest metro station in a bus ride away, meaning that it can take 30-45 minutes to get into the city. Taxi from the airport can be expensive, and if you're on a budget vacation, would be a total waste of money. Instead, take the train to termini (the central train station) and from there, the metro to Anagnina. (the last station on the line a (red)) from there you will have to take a 2 minute bus ride, you should probably call the hotel for directions. The good thing about public transportation in rome is that you can get a 3 day pass for the metro and all busses for quite cheap. Basically, I stayed in the hotel, but spent very few hours there every night, but it was a great base for an extraordinary vacation in Rome

Reviews.Title: “never agian”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: Nothing was good not the room not the food and the travel got to us. We travel a lot and is not fussy but this was not a nice experience.Do not be fooled by the bus stop that is close to the hotel you can stand and wait for the bus for up to 45min and in the heat it was unbearable no shade I will never go there again !!!! The breakfast was also vary poor !!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Rghosh1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really far from the centre of Rome. PLEASE DO NOT BE MISLED BY THE WHOLE SHUTTLE THING IT IS A BIG JOKE AND A COMPLETE LIE THERE IS REALLY NO SUCH FACILITY (YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO CALL AND TELL IT TO COME AND THEN SEARCH FOR IT ALL OVER THE PLACE TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE). The breakfast is also not good. Extremely hard and dry bread only no eggs or any thing good and little juice and that is all. No shower curtain!!!!!! and the whole bathroom gets completely wet when you take bath. The room is not bad but not good either.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: mugseybear
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 days and it was too long!! this hotel is a complete disaster. when we got off the bus on the first day we were so disappointed!! the outside of the hotel is disgusting, we really wanted to turn and go home. the hotel is not well decorated, the receptionest man is so rude, shouted at us because we cudnt understand him. rooms are so basic, not clean, sheets were never changed on the beds -just made up instead. view from the hotel is horrible, it is like wasteground, with a few garage buildings and derlict houses!!! it was so hot wen we stayed here and the smell from the garbage bins outside was horrendous!!! the bar was tiny, we went to go in to it one night and there were 5 staff in it who just looked at us so we turned and walked back out. poppys pizza is behind the hotel, we went there pizzas were nice but lots of local teenagers hanging aorund the area, flying around on scooters shouting abuse at all the tourists. no shops in the area xcept for pam supermarket wer we picked up a fw bits to eat in the evenings. location was a pure disaster. about an hours journey in to rome. once ya come home in the evening there was no going back in to the city for the nite it was too late and we were to xhausted just do not stay in this hotel!!! it has nothing to offer a tourist even though it is cheap.pick a hotel that is nearer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: pepepepepepe
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was dreading coming to the hotel but all in all it wasn't as bad. the staff were excellent and the room was comfartable and cleaned everyday. the hotel is situated miles away from the centre, although the metro is a bus ride away. the problems is there is simply nothing to do in the evenings in that area, and is very boring. the restaurants that we did find in that area were poor. the breakfast in the hotel is poor, and dont be kidded into thinkin there is a gym, solarium, bar or restaurant cause there isnt!! All in all rome is what you make of it, and if you just need a bed its ideal. be careful of taxi drivers (agree a price before hand) and also BEWARE the romans who will offer a picture and then try charging you (can be funny to watch though) All in all Rome is culturally and historically superb and if you get a chance to tour with Dave (the new zealand tour guide) DO IT, HE IS FAB!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Minsk2008
Reviews.Content: We were there in December, over Christmas. Overall it was a good experience. It is true, that the hotel is not in Rome, but the 507 bus takes you in ten minutes to the metro (underground) line A. Line A is impressively good looking line, compared with ugly line B. It also can take you to most sightseeing attractions (at least most of those we wanted to see). The hotel itself is nice and safe. I liked top to bottom window. Room was cleaned everyday, even on Christmas Day. I wouldn't recommend to stay there on Christmas Day and try to see something (or someone) in Rome, because the transportation on this day is very limited. The staff in the hotel is friendly. The breakfast is not versatile at all, and it is nothing like continental breakfast in UK hotels, but coffee was really nice. Fast Pizza Place near the hotel is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: northumberlad
Reviews.Content: The Arcadia Hotel is a great value stay if you want to do Rome 'on the cheap'. The rooms are clean and have a good level of equipment: Sat TV, hair dryer, bath and shower / mixer, fridge etc. The rooms are clean and the staff are very helpful. The location of the hotel is quite a way out from central Rome, however, it is close to Ciampina Airport (2or3 miles) and close to the bus routes to Anangina metro station. The staff will give you a lift to Anangina Metro and a lift back to the hotel on your return. Otherwise, The 507 bus runs between Anangina and the hotel. The hotel will also offer a lift to a local Italian resteraunt that they reccomend. Ignore this, and walk half a mile to the I Peperoncini located on Via Frascineto 67-69. This place offers great food with a great atmosphere. Lots of local families eat here which is allways a good sign. Rome is a beautiful city but be prepared to be ripped off by taxi drivers, cafes and men dressed as roman soldiers (ten euros to have your photo taken with them)...but the Arcadia is at least one place where you will get value for money. We will return....

Reviews.Title: “Airport taxis are a problem”
Reviews.Author: globalskier100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcadia on our last night in Rome because we were catching the early morning Ryanair flight back to Stansted from Ciampino Airport. The Arcadia is only a 10-minute taxi ride from the airport, yet it seems impossible to not be ripped off by taxi drivers. The hotel offers taxi vouchers for 30 euros which is extortionate for the short distance. Instead we asked to use the meter, hoping we could pay 15-20 euros. The taxi arrived 10 minutes before the specified pick-up time and sat there with the meter running. We began the journey with 13 euros already on the meter (they start running the meter when they leave the depot, and charge for waiting time). We put up a considerable protest but the driver would not reduce the amount. The total price to the airport was 25 euros - a complete rip-off. I would not recommend using this hotel as an 'airport hotel' for Ciampino. The hotel itself is of 2-3 star standard, good value for money, but it is in the middle of nowhere. The free shuttle service to a nearby restaurant is useful, and the lady on reception was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Arcadia Hotel Rome is Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: CarinFord
Reviews.Content: September 2007 we stayed in the Arcadia Hotel Rome for 7 nights - after reading the negative reviews we were worried but thought we would make up our own minds. What a pleasant surprise we had, we are a family of four and we had two double rooms which we found to be clean and compared to some hotel rooms we have stayed in Europe it was spacious and at least all the furniture matched. The walls are a bit thin and you can hear a lot of noise from the rooms next door that is the only negative thing we found about the hotel. The staff were really friendly and made us feel welcome. We arrived at the hotel from an early flight from South Africa and thought we would just leave our bags but they gave us an early check-in which was 8:00 in the morning which most hotels will not do. The Supermarket is great and just at the back of the hotel so buying water, snacks etc is a real blessing and is much cheaper. The pizza parlour also at the back of the hotel is good value for money and we enjoyed the local atmosphere and the food was good. Transport was not a problem as the bus stops outside the hotel and takes you directly to the metro and at 1Euro a trip it is really cheap. Value for money the Arcadia hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “The Arcadia Hotel - Nice hotel - wrong place”
Reviews.Author: sixtythree
Reviews.Content: The Staff were very friendly and the bedroom was OK - cleaned every day and fresh towels. The place of the bedroom however was not good, next to a restaurant which closed about 2am so the noise was bad, people enjoying themselves very loudly, and the motor-bikes running up and down the side of the hotel. The hotel was near an industrial area and flats. Also the terrace garden did not exist, four plastic chairs and a table does not make a garden terrace. It was very easy to get the bus and then the metro into Rome, but it was too far out to come back have a shower and get changed and then go back into Rome for the evening.That was the biggest disappointment, after walking round allday and a session on the packed metro going into a nice restaurant was out of the question. Also arriving late at night at the end of the metro was a bit intimidating lots of dodgy characters around the metro and bus station. So really this hotel although reasonable did not make up for the distance from the Centre of Rome. But Rome itself was fabulous and we will be going back again but to another hotel nearer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “1* hotel”
Reviews.Author: rivercold99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few months back. The room was a 1 star level (relative to a US hotel, it was even worse than Motel6). Small room, standing shower, barely any space. Hotel itself is very dingy. Also, a fire alarm went off in the middle of a night and we saw smoke coming out from the next building. The fire engine and cops came quickly. The hotel staff told us 'dont worry, u r ok', but they had no info on why the fire broke out....to me, the safety standards were shoddy! Location-wise, it is far from the main attractions of Rome, but it is accessible by train. You can take the local train (dirty condition) to the city from the train station which is 5min walk from the hotel. Keep in mind the local train stops running around 10pm or so. The ride is ~30mins and then mostly, u have to take another train to get to where u r going. Breakfast was better than a regular continental bkfast. Overall, this hotel is worth no more than $40/night!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: KobieCalgary
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before reading the reviews, so was a little worried before our stay. The hotel was great. It was clean, the staff very helpful and friendly, and the transit sytem was handy to use. The number 507 bus from the end of the metro line takes you almost to the front of the hotel. The money we saved on staying here instead of downtown was significant.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Bad Location. Nothing Worked. Could Not Sleep Due to Noise.”
Reviews.Author: jte23
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel mainly on the basis of other tripadvisor reviews. Thought the location was worth sacrificing to get a better rate. How wrong we were! Many other problems too. A real horror story. Do not book this hotel. Read on to see why. Got in, spent ages trying to unlock the door, room very basic and poorly decorated. But we could handle that. Until the TV didn't work, the Air Conditioning didn't work and the Bathroom was awful. Asked to be moved room. They gave us the room next door, which had no additional inside lock. When we asked why/if we could be moved again, they just assured us that it was safe and the room was one of the newer ones. Bathroom was fine, but Air Conditioning still did not work, TV had no remote. We asked about this. They said they would bring a TV remote up. Never did. They said the Air Conditioning was off because it wasn't summer. It was 26 degrees. We figured since we were here to see Rome, that didn't matter so much and we'd get over it. Still, it was annoying. Journied into Rome. First you must get a bus to Anagnina Station. It only costs 1 Euro, and can be used with the metro if your journey is within 75 minutes. Bus takes around 15/20 minutes. Anagnina is a rough area. Dirty, lots of dodgy characters. Did not feel safe there compared with the rest of Rome and would definatly not recommend coming back too late at night from Rome and be hanging around there. Metro takes you into Termini in about 25 minutes, which isn't bad. But after a day walking around Rome, the commute in and out is very tiring. Especially when you have to get back to a Line A station from wherever you are in Rome, then spend 25 minutes (usually standing) on a subway past, I believe about 15 stops, then waiting around in an unsavoury area, then the 15 minute bus. Bus doesn't operate on a sunday, hotel provides a small shuttle service, which is helpful (one good point). Worst part of all is though, at nighttime, the noise is terrible. Paper thin walls. You can hear everything going on in the neighbouring rooms and in the corridors. Worse still, there is a restaurant just beside the hotel. So if your room is anywhere near it, you won't be able to get to sleep until about 2.A.M, because crowds of diners and drinkers shout, laugh and scream into the night. It feels as if they are right beside you. Even earplugs do little to help. You'll then get woken up again about 6 or 7 by people leaving their rooms with a thunderous roar. In conclusion, we were prepared to get over the smaller inconveniences of the TV, lock and Bathroom, but the Air Conditioning, Noise and Commute meant we had no choice but to move into the centre of Rome for our final night, loosing the money already paid in the process. That hotel was much better and yet rated a 3* also. This hotel deserves to be dropped a few stars. I repeat, do not stay here unless you are happy with sleepness, sweaty nights, poor service and a long commute in and out of Rome everyday through less than secure areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: SantoshB
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was fine...good breakfast....but the location of the hotel sucks big time. First of all, it is nowever near the main tourist places of rome...From Rome Termini, you have to catch the metro and travel 25 min to get down at Anagagina....now that part is ok...from the metro station to the hotel is like 2 miles...and the buses are not that frequent...so its a pain...especially on sunday while we were returning with baggage...they did not have any buses....i wish if they did better in location or provide shuttle services to metro...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, basic but clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: holiday-girl2007
Reviews.Content: My boyfrined and I went for Valentines week, flying from Manchester to Fumicino airport. It should cost around €60 from the airport to the Hotel - but taxi touts really rip you off - I said €60 - they said €75 !! Luckily the Hotel issue you with vouchers for a set fee - you pay either €20 to Ciampino (apporx) or €60 to Fumicino. They even call the taxi's for you so once you hand over the voucher - they can't argue or they'll put their contract in jeopardy. Firstly - on arrival at around 8pm Sunday evening - I was quite upset. Our holiday was supposed to be romantic but after seeing the state of the hotel I got quite upset indeed - considering I had actually paid quite a lot of money for the Sunday-Friday stay. My boyfriend wanted to phone Thomas Cook and get an exchange but we agreed we'd give it a try. AND ARE WE LUCKY WE DID!!!!!!!! What the hotel lacked in 'quality' - the staff certainly made up for in customer service. There is from who I consider the possible manager, a pleasant grey haired man couldn't have been any more helpful. He gave us a map showing where we get the incredibly excellent service of the 507 bus to Anagnina Metro station - this then taking you along a long line of attractions - sights and historial legends. My advice is buy a ticket from reception for €1 each - this can be used on any bus and any metro route - but is only valid for 75 minutes. Therefore I suggest for the amount of times you'll likely be jumping on and off the metro that you buy a weekly ticket - which costs €16 euro - you can purchase these from machines at metro's - but for safety and not to waste your change - i'd highly recommend buying these from newsagents - Giornalo ?? There is one at Anagnina before you get onto a metro. Breakfast is wonderful considering I didn't want to stay there - you could have a choice of tea / coffee / espresso (apparently lethal) chocco latte / hot chocolate (very rich) or cappucino. Then also milk / orange / lemon or other juices. Selection of bread rolls, choco crossaints / vanilla crossaints, cake (which sounds funny but is actually very nice). Also jams, honey etc. The waiting staff are friendly and speak good english. Although a lot of people that stay there are in fact mostly Italians. The sights that are worth seeing - Vatican is a must - Spanish steps / and I'd really recommend 'Rome Christian Tour' as you get an all day pass for €13 from Termini and it takes you around nearly all the sights. Behind the Hotel is a pizza take away - we did not eat there as it soooo did not look appealing. The hotel offer a shuttle to a nearby restaurant about 2km away - food excellent but staff speak poor english so we stuck to what we could pronounce - carbonara! Supermarket behind the hotel is excellent / very very cheap, wine and beer and snacks etc. Well worth a visit if you stay at Arcadia as drinks in mini bar are minimal - no beer only lager etc. We found the gym - near the basement carpark - but couldn't find a solarium, and we didn't notice the bar ever open. Yes the hotel was basic, but it was clean. The staff certainly made up for everything the hotel lacked as they were so helpful and friendly and really helped us out. We used the hotel as somewhere to sleep at night as most of the day we were out sightseeing. One word of advice - EARPLUGS !!!! Highly recommended as local kids hang round pizza place at back of hotel, and you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in your neighbours room! So if you wish to experience YOUR romantic week away rather than your NEIGHBOURS week away - get yourself a good pair of earplugs. I could sleep through an explosion but sadly not with those walls. Happy stay and it wasn't as bad as we'd originally thought. In fact as it's so easy to get around Rome- i'd probably go again. Cannot fault the travel system. So if you just want a very comfy bed for the night, bit of brekkie, and somewhere to get a shower - get yourself to the ARCADIA !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Graham&mary
Reviews.Content: I booked a short break for me and my girlfriend in rome and read that this hotel was ideal for everything. From Ciampino airport it is about 15mins in the taxi. I read up about the local taxi drivers ripping people off so be carefull. They were going to charge us 45 euro's until i declined. They agreed 30euro's, which i still wasnt happy about but what can you do. The drivers over there realy dont care so i wouldnt advise hiring a car as you would find it crazy. We arived at night so didnt see the surrounding area too much. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly. Our room consisted of a double bed and a mini bar. Which is quite reasonable for the drinks, mainly water and cans of diet coke also 2 beers only a few euro's each. Ask for a map from the hotel reception, which if we didnt have we would not of been able too manage. It was clear and very well layed out even for the less geograpghical person. All the places you could want too visit are on the map. The local bus is around the corner from the hotel and takes you to the metro station where you can get on and off at any place you want to visit. At the metro station you can buy a 3 day travel pass costing 11euro's per person. That will allow you to travel unlimited on the bus and metro system. We didnt encounter any pick pockets you hear of, but just be carefull especialy on the metro's and in the city. Around the corner from the hotel was "pippo's pizza" a friendly pizzaria! cheap aswel. Ideal for a late night snack. There is a local restauraunt close by, and if you ask at reception they will take you for free. This hotel is an ideal base for young couple's and family's. The breakfast is basic but sets you up untill lunch. There are not any bars close by that we noticed. And i wouldnt like to travel back from the centre of rome on the metro at night drunk. We realy enjoyed our stay and would reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean comfortablt stay.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gem_mcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip to rome last year. we had never travelled to italy before so were pretty clueless apart fom the guide book we had! the hotel staff were friendly, approachable and extremely helpful. the room was fantastic. for a 3 star hotel we were really surprised! it was cleaned everyday and me being extremely messy, all my clothes were folded up for me on our bed! (I made sure i left a tip when i checked out!) the room was a good size and we also had a balcony. there was also a supermarket close by and the bus route into rome was a 5 min walk away. they also had a driver who would take you to a local restaurant and pick you up when you were finished. the food was excellent, as was the wine. even though the hotel is not in the centre of rome it was a short bus and train ride away, which saved us a lot of money! all in all, a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for People on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: MelissaC1983
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed @ the hotel for 4 nights. On arrival an Ciampino Airport a taxi driver immediately approached us and practically snatched our luggage hands and conned us out of 40 euros to take us the short distance to the hotel (on our day of departure the hotel called us a taxi and he only charged us 10 euros so shows we got ripped off badly when we got there!!!). We found reception to be very helpful and they provided us with a map for the buses/metro. The hotel is very basic, but very clean and comfortable. The bus stop was right outside the hotel and takes you stright to Anaganina from there you catch the metro - this is by far the best way to travel around Rome and also very very cheap, we never had any probs with theives or pickpockets (but take care of handbags etc still as you can never be to sure), the only thing we did experience was people getting on the trains begging for money, but just avoid eye contact and they won't bother you. The only problem we had was on the Friday when there was a bus strike from early morning right through till about 6pm so we were stuck @ the hotel all day which was pretty boring as it is in the middle of nowhere and there doesn't seem to be any english channels on the tv!!! Overrall our stay at the hotel was quiet and comfortable and was ideal for what we needed, which was really just a place to sleep on a budget as we were out site seeing most of the time. Just one other thing to mention is that the walls are quite thin so if you stay in the hotel just have a thought for the people in the rooms next to you as on our stay we had one night where the couple next door desided to have a massive drunken argument and we could here the whole thing!!! If were to visit Rome again I would probably stay @ this hotel if were on a budget but would probably look to stay in a Hotel in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value.”
Reviews.Author: JulieBlue
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and found it very easy to get to the centre of Rome. Please do not be affraid to use the public transport, the bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you right to the metro and the metro took us right to the centre of Rome. The transport system is very reliable and frequent, for 11 euro's you can purchase a ticket to travel on the public transport for 3 days. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful, we were given a map as soon as we arrived which happened to be very handy. Keep tight of your bags etc. as pick pockets are all around, we did not encounter any problems with them but you must be on your gaurd at all times. The cleanliness at this hotel was very good, the bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Double -booked!!”
Reviews.Author: scentsitive
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night and arrived very late (about 01.15). I had indicated to the hotel that we would be late and they said this wouldn't be a problem. However, on arrival we were told that another couple had booked the room for three nights and the man behind the desk offered to book us into another hotel down the road (actually it was about 10mins away). We were so tired by this time that we had no alternative but to fall in with these plans. WARNING - don't check in late here!! Never got to see the room here, but the hotel is a nightmare to find unless you have a Tomtom, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location but cheap”
Reviews.Author: defone
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed how this hotel is marketing itself. This is not NEAR of metro station, you have to take a route bus to get there. It takes about 35-50 minutes in a full bus and metro to get to the central. Venue is horrible, hotel is middle of some industrial area. Taxi from fiumicino to hotel was 78e. Biggest problem was location so we had to change the hotel. Also breakfast was horrible but there's a supermarket right next of the hotel where you can get something decent to eat.

Reviews.Title: “basic basic basic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishchick3
Reviews.Content: ok where do i start?having read the reviews of hotel arcadia we were also in two minds whether to go or not .when we arrived at ciampino airport taxi's were on strike and we did not know this!!so make sure and check before!!luckily i saw a bus with anagnina on it and i asked the bus driver.bus was dirt cheap 3euro for myself and boyfriend to the hotel.went we got to anagnina we got the 507 bus to the hotel-seemingly u av to buy a ticket before u get on the bus but nobody checks the tickets but if inspectors chek u get a 50euro fine so beware!! when we arrived at the stop the bus driver very nicely told us it was our turn to get off-the hotel is very run down at the back and the shutters on the windows arent very appealing-however the front enterance to the hotel is a bit nicer-the lady on reception was ok, just handed us the key and i had to ask what time brekkie was at.she didnt even show us to the room and hardly spoke two words.hotel cud do witha good clean up-rooms are soooooo basic-we had no balcony and we booked months in advance.no shower booth jus a shower over the bath with no curtain!!toilet was dat small u cud hardly swing a cat in it-cleaners cleaned the rooms every morning but wait for it!!!didnt change the sheets just folded dem bak up-cleaners are scary lookin so i wudnt leave any valuables in the rooms-no safe in the rooms either!!!!! the tv is krap all stupid italian channels mtv was ok but soo fuzzy we cudnt make nethin out-mini bar is krap full of soft drinks and one can of beer0dey cost 2.50euro each and u av to pay on d way out!! no sauna dat we seen unless it is down in the underground carpark!!!!and u wudnt wanna go down der alone!! a line of bins outside the hotel stink!!!u can find it wen u open da windows in the morning!!air con is krap too d lowest air is even cool eneough. hotel however is very quiet and no disturbances at all. breakfast is another story-we only went one morning despite payn for it for the 6 monrnings because it was so bad-the milk is like butter and der is nothing only bread to eat-no fry or nethin!!wot an insult to us!! there is a pizza place behind the hotel called poppys pizza-pizza lurvly in it!! but it is full of young italians every nite and we wer the only customers to be seen!!dey also shouts tings at us wen we passin by!!pam d supermarket behind the hotel is useless-no sweeties or nethin in it -and its not one bit cheap!! and watch out for the ignorant receptionist man dat does the nite work in it-he gave out to us cos my bf had no change only a hundred euro note he roared at us do u tink dis is a bank we are in?? very very rude and he is so slow we nearly missed our bus to the airport on the last day because he kept holding us bak!! he is a sillly silly man and do not be nice to em-the staff were horrible al in all.dey told us nothin at all wasnt impressed at all!!!we went on the metro every day very handy but its usually packed to capacity-we visted the colloseum it was amzing-do not stay in this hotel during the day or u wud be bored silly- the buses are funny on a sunday so the hotel ran us to the metro station free of charge cudnt beleve it but make sur dey say it is free or dey mite put it on ur tab without sayin!!we didnt go near d restaraunt at all bcoz never neone in it at all!!no bar or nufn!!!very dissapointed wit the service in this hotel-also not in a great location-watch out for pickpockets espec on the spanish steps-we had a close encounter. the markets are great-haggle with them and get tings evry cheap.all in all i wudnt go bak to this hotel but it is bearable for a few days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Arcadia”
Reviews.Author: merry man of the midlands
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome in June and after reading all of the reviews that others had left with regards to the Arcadia Hotel we were in 2 minds weather to cancel and book elsewhere, but thought what the hell lets go for it, and we are so glad that we did stay there !!! We arrived at the hotel at 11.00, given a very warm welcome and was suprised to be told that our rooms were ready well before our check in time. The room itself (302) was smashing with one of the comfortablest beds i have had the pleasure of sleeping in. The bathroom was suberb with a large shower cubicle with water pressure that would remove skin given the chance, very well equipped with soft white towels, shower gel, shampoo and hair dryer. The room we were in also had patio doors and a balcony with a view towards rome (not much to look out at but nice and quite) there was a TV with limited channels, wardrobe and dressing table. TIP... leave the aircon on when you go out for the day it isn't the most powerful of units but is refreshing enough to keep the room cool. The breakfast is basic but does give a good start to the day (beware the coffee its lethal) To get into Rome takes about on average 30-40 mins via bus and metro the bus stop is just around the corner from the hotel and run frequently in the week (when they want on sundays but down the road) Bus No. 507 takes you to the bus/metro station you can buy your combined bus/metro ticket from the hotel or at the metro station and very cheap to buy (€16.00 for 7 days). Ask the hotel for a free map it has all the metro routes on and places of interest. The gym and sauna are very basic but overall the hotel is EXCELLENT and i would recommend staying there to anyone and for the price they charge it is very very good value for money and with it being away from the centre it is also nice and peaceful on an evening. As for the hotel staff if they worked at Mcdonalds they would all have 5 stars on there badge and be managers in weeks. (LOL) there english was great and all the staff that we met were only to happy to help and offer advice. ( i would stay at the hotel for the staff alone) There is a small restaurant to the rear of the hotel, offered a very basic menu and we had to wait in excess of an hour for our meal and even then it wasn't complete. The supermarket is great for stocking up on drinks and fresh fruit and all very cheap. Take a trip to the TIME ELEVATOR early in your visit as they give you an extremely handy tourist book that is full of maps, museums markets and routes to follow. The taxi from Ciampino airport cost us €30.00 but we agreed the price before setting off, the first taxi driver we asked wanted €35.00. On your return to the airport buy a voucher from hotel reception. When in Termini make sure you have plenty of change for toilets as on average it cost 70 cent. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again Hope you found my review of use please feel free to contact me if i can be of help.

Reviews.Title: “Bitter Sweet”
Reviews.Author: mariasolis1
Reviews.Content: Okay folks, my boyfriend and I wanted to find a cheap hotel to stay in with its own bathroom. This place looked close enough but after a hard day of touring the grand city and trying to get over jet lag this place was far from perfect. I looked at the online reviews for this site at other travel sites and thought not bad. It wasn't until I attempeted to get there that I realized this place wan't what it originally advertised. Okay It is very close to public transportation if it happens to be working at the time. The subway is still under construction so it stops working at 10:00 PM after that you have to take a bus (which is not reliable timewise, so much so that they do not post a time schedule, they get there when they get there!) to the end of the subway line and wait for another to take you. Not so bad but when you are standing outside in the dead of winder it was horrible. When we finally got to the hotel we had to walk a block to get there and saw the neighborhood we were in, think Van Nuys, California so you know what I mean. They don't look like they cared much on the outside with dog poop and weeds everwhere. When we got there the staff were super nice but our room looked like something out of motel six (the pictures that I originally looked at were different). After a hard day I could really care less but the super thin walls made it impossible to sleep when our neighbors keeps laughing and shouting part of the night. The view into the countryside was beautiful but the hotel looked like something out of Tijuana. On the plus side it was next to a grocery store called PAM which was great for cheap food. That comes in handy because there is not much of a choice food wise. They do have a free Italian style breakfast which basically is just bread and coffee. They do have cereal and milk but the milk is extremely rich which I wasn't used to. So some rules of thumb for this hotel: Know how to get there bus wise, if you wait too late you have to take the evening bus and that takes a while (until they finally finish the subway construction). Be well versed in the bus routes and when they run. Take in mind there is a different evening line after 10:00 PM so you do not wait for a bus that will never come. DO NOT TAKE A TAXI TO THE HOTEL! You will be charged $60-$80 for a quick ride on the bus. They are pretty aggresive so try to ignore them. Try to get a room that is at least one room separated from your neighbors if you want to sleep. Also be sure to get the numbers to the hotel and VERIFY them before hand, every time we tried to call the hotel we realized that they listed their fax not their telephone number.There is a plus to this hotel in that you have your own bathroom (which you have to pay extra for in the center of Rome) and the low prices. The staff is really nice. And once you take the subway you are local to everything so its not that bad. Overall it is an ok hotel if all you want to do is lay down your head. Just don't expect anything fancy. Overall it was okay. May stay there again once they fix the subway!

Reviews.Title: “arcadia is cheap, cheerfull ,but isolated”
Reviews.Author: smiley70
Reviews.Content: Arcadia was cheap,with cheerfull staff, and had spacious rooms that were warm enough. But there is no solarium or gym. NO shower curtain either . And it was isolated, so you can't pop back to the hotel for a while in the afternoon, during sightseeing. Pizza place & supermarket around back of hotel. The area the hotel is in is safe in day/night. It is a 40 min walk to anagnina metro station on a sunday. Otherwise get the 507 bus to/from that metro station. Taxi drivers are an absolute rip off. It is €30 to/from ciampino airport. Agree a price before entering a taxi. Taxi's are white. At ciampino, taxi's are operated by touts. You will be approached by one, and he will grab your bag/or your printed hotel voucher and lead you to a taxi.He may then charge you more than the meter says. The metro has multi day tickets which are good on buses too. The hotel can be noisy enough from 7am onwards. No tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but there IS a basic mini bar fridge. Rome itself is VERY old. Read a history book before going. The best attractions are colloseum ( €10 entry),pantheon temple, st. peters square ( where pope appears at the window on sunday morning 12-12.15 pm ). Sistine chapel/vatican museum is also good (€12 entry). You must enter this building before 12.20pm. Exit before 1.45?. There are about 8 rooms to go through before you get to sistine chapel. So allow enough time. Most other attractions are very old ruins. Watch for PICKPOCKETS everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and reasonabley cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel only last week and found it to be good enough for the very cheap price we payed for it . Not the hotels fault but we got fleeced by a taxi from the airport - he dropped us at the wrong hotel and dissapeared 60 euros richer it cost us the same to get back to the hotel we should have been at. Watch out for the taxis in general - campino to arcadia should cost no more than 30 euros and take no more than about 15 - 20 mins . Please note also that public transport is good it can take a while to ge tinto central rome from the hotel . You need to take a no 507 bus to anangina metro station and then onwards from there this can take overall from 45 mins to 2 hours at peak times - value for money though as three day travel pass costs only 11 Euros this can be used on bus and metro . Rooms are clean and basic but no shower curtain or tea/coffee facilities although there is a mini fridge with sodas,water and beer all reasonably cheap . Only small pizzeria locally to eat out in , we used the large PAM supermarket to the rear of the property to buy our own food good if on a budget or after getting ripped off by a taxi . reception staff all have good english wich is a help and will offer free shutle bus to metro if in good mood . Breakfast nice if a bit repetitive but sets ypu up well for the day . Overall I would stay again and would be better prepared this time as all in all the hotel is good value for money . Please email any questions about arcadia or rome anytime i will be glad to help .

Reviews.Title: “wheres the metro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The travel agent had informed us that the hotel was close to the Metro (Really) so we thought OK so off we went. arriving at ciampino the transfer guy was there so we thought this is good. Having suffered at the hands of Ryanair at liverpool about baggage weight which is another story (we had 25 Kilos for both of us the entitlement is 25 each including hand baggage so we paid £27 for being underweight) Anyway the guy got us too the hotel in about 20 minutes which was Ok. checked in, found the room ,dumped the bags and set of for the metro. Next to the hotel so we walked all around the block, no metro. Back to the reception, weres the Metro, you need a 507 bus or a taxi to get to the Metro its in Anagnina this is Frascati. Anyway once we got around to it the travelling around is fairly simple. On the way back it took over an hour and a half to get to the airport. A point to note , dont go to the airport at 8 in the morning leave at least an hour earlier to get time for a coffee and not be rushed. The hotel we found to be clean and minimilistic the staff helpful and ok for what we required. However it would be nice to have coffee making facilities in the bare rooms. We would not stay here again though, its too far from the city and running the gauntlet of pickpockets and theives on the Metro I found quite unerving and you can never relax or you will end up with no wallet bags or anything else

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: GH-UK
Reviews.Content: Originally saw deal in Thomas Cooks window but after searching on web found exact same trip half the price (JUST AS WELL! :o). Info on web said taxi from Ciampino is 15 euros but is double this! Have to admit when first arrived at the hotel I was a little scared! Hotel and area look v run down from outside, and there are none of the mountain views that are shown on the web. To say it's "Modern white ... overlooking ruins" is v 'deceptive'! Inside rooms are very basic but clean. Upon check-in no-one mentioned the complimentary breakfast so we missed this on first morning and only found out about it when waiting in queue at reception for bus tickets, overheard someone else being informed. There were none of the amenities mentioned on web (no gym, solarium or bar!!) Public transport was good and v cheap, so if you're just after somewhere v basic and cheap to sleep, then this place is perfect otherwise stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Survived the hotel.... surprisingly”
Reviews.Author: bvicritter
Reviews.Content: First piece of advice.... avoid rome at christmas. Everything is shut tight on that day! As for the hotel... took a looong time to get there. From the train station had to travel the metro right to the end of the long line. From there it is possible to take a bus but not advisable on the first attempt as the stop is a little unclear. A cab from the metro to the hotel was 15 euro. I asked the price first and that is what the cabbie quoted me even though the meter read 8 euro and then went up to only just over 10 when he hit a button to add on charge for luggage. So definately got ripped off there. Got to the front desk, was given the room key and off we went. At this point we were both a little nervous as the area is very much in the "ghetto". Very unnerving and dodgey felling. The room was ok, bathroom satisfactory (bath with shower hose but no shower curtain to keep the water IN the bathtub area). Did find a silverfish bug in the bathroom too... eww. English tv was only cnn and a show or two on mtv. so not much there to keep entertained. I went down to the front desk and asked where i could get some food. I was told that the only place is the pizza place out back. That was the good part of the location. Inexpensive and tastey food, family run and open on christmas. On boxing day the bus route was very odd. The front dest said nothign about changed routes. On the way back 7 of us from the hotel ended up totally accross town in the evening. When we were talking to them about the hotel they said that they found the hotel alright, breakfast was great and the car service was a great help. Breakfast!!? Car service!? My friend and i were told nothing about this any of the times that we were at the front desk!!! We were on day 4 of our 5 day stay so taht really got to me. I guess it just depends on who does your check in. All in all we survived the stay, slept inbetween burst of noise (rooms are not sound proof at all!) and coughed up the cash to get to the airport at the end. (30 Euro to ciampino)
